creator: deweese@apache.org
text:
The problem is that the one image is gray scale JPEG.
We interpret this as linear gray scale, which causes it to be
lightened.  If you convert these to a more standard RGB JPEG
they will display correctly.  It has nothing to do with the
semi-transparent rect overlapping it.

Incidentally if anyone knows an easy way to get a gamma
corrected gray scale ICC profile we could fix this for
real...

creator: admin@talente.ro
text:
It was one or two weeks ago when I've talked with jdb and heycam on irc at  
freenode #svg and the initial bug was fixed ! Than it was more than it is now ! 
A image even not overlapsed was tograyscaled after conversion but now it seem 
that is ok, but under rectangles still seem to be buggy. Maybe is just an 
impression of mine !

creator: deweese@apache.org
text:
This _is_ an issue with proper handling of gamma.
Overlap is not important.

*** This bug has been marked as a duplicate of 22260 ***
